newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia banks may seek Tomskneft oil parent stake.
newsitem.headline: Russia banks may seek Tomskneft oil parent stake.

text.p: Two of Russia's biggest banks, AB Inkombank and AKB Tokobank may bid for 34 percent in OAO Eastern Oil Company, whose main operating unit is Tomskneft, an Eastern Oil spokesman said on Monday.
Neither bank was immediately available for comment.
Inkombank and Tokobank last year prepared preliminary terms of the tender with Eastern Oil. The 34 percent stake is due to be tendered some time this year.
The Fuel and Energy Ministry and the State Property Committee are finishing tender terms which must be approved by the cabinet, the spokesman said.
The state owns 51 percent of Eastern.
According to preliminary estimates, Eastern's 1996 net profit rose to 898.0 billion roubles from 722.8 billion in 1995. Oil production remained flat at 11.2 million tonnes.
